learning_outcomes.description: Understand what social entrepreneurship is and the scope of the field.
Use lean startup methodology to adapt social business models.
Practically execute a social business model in entrepreneurial teams.

assessments.task_description:
Purpose:

  • To gain in-depth experience of the social issue of focus;
  • To review relevant academic research literature relating to social issue solutions;
  • To compel students to engage external stakeholders early in their project design;
  • To test social impact model assumptions early and often;
  • To show students the process for and power of an assumption testing approach to entrepreneurship;
  • To have clarity around a ‘solution’ to be tested in the next phase.

Task: In teams of no more than 5 members, students are to do a 15 minute presentation covering the following themes:

  • Case example of social issue (evidence of empathetic engagement);
  • Initial 4-box PCSM (problem-cause-strategy-measure);
  • External and internal scan;
  • Assumptions within the PCSM model chosen to be tested;
  • Why these assumptions;
  • How did you test the assumptions;
  • Diversity of stakeholders engaged;
  • Causes, Perspectives and Theories;
  • Solution review (3 alternatives);
  • Solution selection;
  • What did you learn;
  • What changes will you make to your evolving social impact model (PCSM)?
  • Solution to be tested in next phase.

Key Information:

  • Not all students have to present but ALL students must contribute to compiling the presentation;
  • All students in the team must have their full names visible on the first screen of the video. They must also be seen in the video (cameras turned on);
  • Students are to submit the presentation by the due date, after which no changes can be made. Teams must present the same presentation as that submitted and with no further changes.
  • This is a group mark;
  • All students in the team will get the group mark unless team members feel inequity in all members getting the same mark. In cases where the team feels that the group mark should not be shared equally (e.g. a team member contributed nothing) then those students with the grievance should write to the Lecturer explaining the situation and the percentage of effort contributed by the team member in question.

Upload

For Assessment, each team is required to upload their presentation slides to Blackboard.

AI Statement

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Each team is to upload their video to the TIMS7329 Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Purpose: This assessment item has four learning objectives:

  1. To test students’ ability to develop social impact solutions based on a social impact model;
  2. To test students’ ability to actually execute a social impact solution;
  3. To test students’ ability to learn from social solution testing and modify their social business model accordingly;
  4. To test student’s ability to choose consistent high impact contributions to the team and project.

In the same teams as last assessment, Students are to do a 10-minute pre-recorded video presentation covering the following themes:

  • PCSM after Test the Problem
  • Problem, Cause, Solution Design Features map
  • Hypothesis map & Selection
  • Experiment (design and execution)
  • Fidelity assessment
  • New insights from experiment
  • Finishing PCSM compared with one at end of Test the Problem
  • Business Model (profit model, value proposition, business strategy, risk management)
  • Evidence of financial sustainability;
  • Justify why this venture should be a social enterprise design and not a purely commercial venture;
  • Critique your test the solution experiment and business models in terms of whether to persevere, pivot or perish;
  • Course reflections

Key Information:

  • Not all students have to present, but ALL students must contribute to compiling the presentation;
  • All students in the team must have their full names visible on the first screen of the video. They must also be seen in the video (cameras turned on);
  • This is a group mark;
  • All students in the team will get the group mark unless team members feel inequity in all members getting the same mark. In cases where the team feels that the group mark should not be shared equally (eg. a team member contributed nothing) then those students with the grievance should write to the Lecturer explaining the situation and the percentage of effort contributed by the team member in question.

AI Statement

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Purpose of Assessment 3:

1)     supply evidence for how you contributed as an individual to your project;

2)     supply evidence of how you have demonstrated the core skills of the course;

3)     show evidence of learning from experience about how to apply the core skills effectively

Rationale: Assessments 1 and 2 are group-based assessments. However, each student needs to demonstrate that they have individually acquired the core skills of the course. We need to assess your individual, not just group-based, capabilities.

Individual Evidence of how you have demonstrated the core skills of the course

Task: There are two things to do:

1.     Written Table (20%) – Using the prescribed template (refer Blackboard), please fill out the Table for you as an Individual. In circumstances where a particular core skill was not your focus/job on the team please say so. However, as mentioned throughout the semester, students should still try to have some involvement in all core skills. Please submit your Table by the due date through turn-it-in Blackboard

2.     Individual In-Person Interview (30%) – bring your submitted written Table to an Individual Interview with a member of the Teaching Team. An interview will be scheduled for you and the purpose is to further explore the evidence provided in your written Table.

AI Statement:

rtificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

AI should not be the dominant evidence cited across the core skills. That is, we are mainly interested in how you personally have developed the core skills not AI.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Students are to submit via Turn-it-In through the Blackboard Assessment link
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.
